definition[0]: to hit someone, especially a child, with your open hand in order to punish them
example[0]: the debate about whether parents should smack their children
definition[1]: to hit something hard against something else so that it makes a short loud noise
example[1]: He smacked the money down on the table and walked out.
definition[2]: to hit someone hard with your closed hand
definition[3]: a hit with your open hand, especially to punish a child
example[2]: You’re going to get a smack in a minute!
definition[4]: a hard hit with your closed hand
example[3]: Talk like that and I’ll give you a smack in the mouth.
definition[5]: a short loud noise caused when something hits something else
example[4]: The book landed with a smack.
definition[8]: exactly or directly in the middle of something, in front of something etc
example[5]: There was a hole smack in the middle of the floor.
note[1]: smack in the middle/in front of something etc
example[6]: It’s smack dab in the middle of an earthquake zone.
definition[9]: if something goes smack into something, it hits it with a lot of force
example[7]: The car ran smack into the side of the bus.
